intro: Peucedanum euryptera, commonly known as the broad-leaved angelica, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. The plant is characterized by its large, compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its roots are thick and fleshy, which are often harvested for medicinal purposes. Peucedanum euryptera is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
